The Ver headline this morning: “Phones are going to get weird next week.” They’re not wrong. MWC 2026 is showing foldable gaming handhelds, AI-powered everything, and designs that make you do a double-take.

And honestly? I’m here for it.

The Smartphone Rut

Smartphones have been boring for years. Same slab of glass. Slightly better camera. Incrementally faster chip. We’ve hit a plateau where the $400 phone does everything the $1400 phone does, just with fewer cameras you’ll never use.

item.title: Samsung S26: The Stuff They Don't Want You To Notice
item.author: arty.craftson@pottersquill.com (Arty Craftson)
item.description:
Samsung announced the S26 this week. I’ve been poking through the specs and early reviews. Here’s what’s real versus what’s marketing BS.

Actual Improvements

Camera got better. Larger sensor. Low-light should be noticeably improved. Everything else is computational — which Samsung’s been good at for years.

Slightly bigger battery. Maybe 10-15% more real-world use. Not game-changing, but welcome.

Screen brighter. Useful if you’re outside a lot. Otherwise, you’re not cranking brightness that high anyway.
